definition: disgrace/dishonor/to insult/to bring disgrace or humiliation to/to be indebted to/self-deprecating/Taiwan pr. [ru4]

sentences.english: She fled to her parents’ house to escape an abusive marriage.
sentences.chinese: 爲了逃避屈辱的婚姻，她逃到父母家。

sentences.english: And Russia is making up for past humiliations after the collapse of the USSR.
sentences.chinese: 俄羅斯在洗刷前蘇聯瓦解之後所蒙受的屈辱。

sentences.english: There is an abasement because of glory: and there is one that shall lift up his head from a low estate.
sentences.chinese: 有的屈辱來自尊榮，但也有人從卑微中擡起了頭。

sentences.english: To myself the event was both humiliating and insulting.
sentences.chinese: 對我個人來講是一個屈辱的經歷。

sentences.english: Less swim unwilling humiliation was younger sister, have vowed to take on their own hard.
sentences.chinese: 少遊不甘被小妹屈辱，誓言會靠自己發奮。

sentences.english: We shall not forget national humiliation.
sentences.chinese: 我們不要忘記國家屈辱的歷史。

sentences.english: Christ's triumph was in His humiliation.
sentences.chinese: 基督在他的屈辱中得到勝利。

sentences.english: There is no retreat but in submission and slavery!
sentences.chinese: 後退就只能是甘受屈辱和奴役。

sentences.english: They suffered many humiliations in those dark days.
sentences.chinese: 在那黑暗的年月，他們受過許多屈辱。

sentences.english: Sometimes I felt so mortified I almost wanted to cry.
sentences.chinese: 有時候，我感到很是屈辱，幾欲痛哭。

sentences.english: In sociological branch system, it always suffers all kinds of abasement as second-class citizen.
sentences.chinese: 在社會學科體系中，它總是作爲二等公民受盡屈辱。

sentences.english: "They were either shot dead by the Japanese or forced to commit suicide," Li said.
sentences.chinese: “他們都是被日本侵略者射殺或不忍屈辱自殺”李說。

sentences.english: I would rather die than live in dishonour.
sentences.chinese: 與其屈辱地活着，我寧願去死。

sentences.english: He's held up humiliation by a momentary slip.
sentences.chinese: 他因一念之差而蒙受屈辱。

sentences.english: The Darkstar watched him approach, his eyes filled with contempt and dread.
sentences.chinese: 暗黑之星看着他走近，眼裏充滿了屈辱和恐懼。

sentences.english: Being slandered that way made his blood boil , and he shook with anger.
sentences.chinese: 受到這樣的屈辱，他情緒激動，氣得發抖。

definition: to endure humiliation as part of an important mission (idiom); to suffer in silence
